channel.title: Netbeans
channel.description:
So I'm trying to run my server through netbeans, since eclipse isn't working on my laptop. Can anybody help me setting it up? I already googled it but I couldn't find a tutorial.
I think I'm on the good way, but not completely there, this is my error when trying to run server.java (That's what I need to run right?) [spoiler]run: server.ini doesn't exist! Error loading settings! java.io.FileNotFoundException: ..\Data\server.ini (Het systeem kan het opgegeven pad niet vinden) at java.io.FileInputStream.open0(Native Method) Loaded 0 doors in 2ms. [CRITICAL] Can't load ../data/requirements.txt at java.io.FileInputStream.open(FileInputStream.java:195) [ObjectDef] DONE LOADING OBJECT CONFIGURATION at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:138) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:93) at server.server.main(server.java:145) java.io.FileNotFoundException: ..\Data\config\doors.txt (Het systeem kan het opgegeven pad niet vinden) at java.io.FileInputStream.open0(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(FileInputStream.java:195) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:138) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(FileReader.java:72) at server.world.Doors.processLineByLine(Doors.java:227) at server.world.Doors.load(Doors.java:218) at server.server.main(server.java:158) java.io.FileNotFoundException: ..\Data\world\Maps\map_index (Het systeem kan het opgegeven pad niet vinden) at java.io.FileInputStream.open0(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(FileInputStream.java:195) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:138) at server.clip.region.Region.load(Region.java:310) at server.server.main(server.java:168) Server is already in use. npc.cfg: file not found. npcdrops.cfg: file not found. autospawn.cfg: file not found. item.cfg: file not found. Loaded 0 weight definitions in 0ms. java.io.FileNotFoundException: ..\data\weight.txt (Het systeem kan het opgegeven pad niet vinden) at java.io.FileInputStream.open0(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(FileInputStream.java:195) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:138) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(FileReader.java:72) at server.players.items.weight.WeightDefinitions.processLineByLine(WeightDefinitions.java:79) at server.players.items.weight.WeightDefinitions.load(WeightDefinitions.java:69) at server.server.main(server.java:184) shops.cfg: file not found.[/spoiler]

item.title: Netbeans
item.dc:creator: @dwarfs222 dwarfs222
item.description:
@dwarfs222 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:552571”]Netbeans/IDE’s execute the environments a little differently.
Sometimes this will create issues with file paths (as seen in your spoiler).
You could try moving the Data folder into the /bin/ directory of the server to fix it, or changing the path to the data folder.[/quote]

Chassy13:

Any reason specifically why Eclipse is not working on your laptop?

I thank both of you for trying to help, but I got eclipse working.
It had something to do with having a 32 bit java version on 64 bit pc.

Read full topic

item.title: Netbeans
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Any reason specifically why Eclipse is not working on your laptop?

Read full topic

item.title: Netbeans
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Netbeans/IDE’s execute the environments a little differently.
Sometimes this will create issues with file paths (as seen in your spoiler).
You could try moving the Data folder into the /bin/ directory of the server to fix it, or changing the path to the data folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Netbeans
item.dc:creator: @dwarfs222 dwarfs222
item.description:
@dwarfs222 wrote:

So I’m trying to run my server through netbeans, since eclipse isn’t working on my laptop.
Can anybody help me setting it up? I already googled it but I couldn’t find a tutorial.

I think I’m on the good way, but not completely there, this is my error when trying to run server.java (That’s what I need to run right?)
[spoiler]run:
server.ini doesn’t exist!
Error loading settings!
java.io.FileNotFoundException: …\Data\server.ini (Het systeem kan het opgegeven pad niet vinden)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open0(Native Method)
Loaded 0 doors in 2ms.
[CRITICAL] Can’t load …/data/requirements.txt
at java.io.FileInputStream.open(FileInputStream.java:195)
[ObjectDef] DONE LOADING OBJECT CONFIGURATION
at java.io.FileInputStream.(FileInputStream.java:138)
at java.io.FileInputStream.(FileInputStream.java:93)
at server.server.main(server.java:145)
java.io.FileNotFoundException: …\Data\config\doors.txt (Het systeem kan het opgegeven pad niet vinden)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open0(Native Method)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open(FileInputStream.java:195)
at java.io.FileInputStream.(FileInputStream.java:138)
at java.io.FileReader.(FileReader.java:72)
at server.world.Doors.processLineByLine(Doors.java:227)
at server.world.Doors.load(Doors.java:218)
at server.server.main(server.java:158)
java.io.FileNotFoundException: …\Data\world\Maps\map_index (Het systeem kan het opgegeven pad niet vinden)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open0(Native Method)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open(FileInputStream.java:195)
at java.io.FileInputStream.(FileInputStream.java:138)
at server.clip.region.Region.load(Region.java:310)
at server.server.main(server.java:168)
Server is already in use.
npc.cfg: file not found.
npcdrops.cfg: file not found.
autospawn.cfg: file not found.
item.cfg: file not found.
Loaded 0 weight definitions in 0ms.
java.io.FileNotFoundException: …\data\weight.txt (Het systeem kan het opgegeven pad niet vinden)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open0(Native Method)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open(FileInputStream.java:195)
at java.io.FileInputStream.(FileInputStream.java:138)
at java.io.FileReader.(FileReader.java:72)
at server.players.items.weight.WeightDefinitions.processLineByLine(WeightDefinitions.java:79)
at server.players.items.weight.WeightDefinitions.load(WeightDefinitions.java:69)
at server.server.main(server.java:184)
shops.cfg: file not found.[/spoiler]

Read full topic
